channel.title: Whats the hottest setup/computer
channel.description:
Whats the hottest setup/computer out right now.
My budget it 800 dollars.

item.title: Whats the hottest setup/computer
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:16, topic:297907”][quote author=Old Rsc Player link=topic=394278.msg2932332#msg2932332 date=1251344864]

1GB RAM with Vista?!?

The processor kills the ram, it runs very fast.
[/quote]

Made no real sense

Anyway you need to build it yourself to get the most out of it.[/quote]

I ment that 1gb ram is fine, its the processor that keeps my computer running fast

Read full topic

item.title: Whats the hottest setup/computer
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I built a rig a couple weeks ago with Quad Core 9400, 4GB Ram, Nvidia GTS250, and A Gigabyte mothermoard. I sed a expensive and overkill PSU. I built that for 910 or something and considering the PSU and the Case you could probably knock 100 off that if you do some more configuration.

item.title: Whats the hottest setup/computer
item.dc:creator: @Tree_Climber Tree_Climber
item.description:
@Tree_Climber wrote:

[quote=“Old Rsc Player, post:11, topic:297907”][quote author=cumescape link=topic=394278.msg2932081#msg2932081 date=1251335337]
1GB RAM with Vista?!?
[/quote]

The processor kills the ram, it runs very fast. Its unbelieveable for 300 bucks, however I want something that can run a bunch of shit[/quote]
Do it yourself.
http://promotions.newegg.com/AMD/Bundle3_2/index.html?cm_sp=Cat_CPUs-Processors--AMDBundle32--http%3a%2f%2fpromotions.newegg.com%2fAMD%2fBundle3_2%2f156x340.jpg Buy the 3rd option.
Then get a case with a PSU ~$100-200, Then a dvd burner ~$50 max. Then a good graphics card, can get one for around $100. Just go cheaper on the case/psu and on the dvd burner and get a really good graphics card.
If you play your cards right that’ll come out at around $800.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats the hottest setup/computer
item.dc:creator: @Tree_Climber Tree_Climber
item.description:
@Tree_Climber wrote:

[quote=“Old Rsc Player, post:8, topic:297907”]My current computer that I have I bought for 300 dollars and just upgraded the video card (from a older pc)

Its gonna turn into a peice of shit soon, I can feel it coming. So im gonna toss it to my lil sisters.

My current setup is

Running on vista

Intel® Pentium® 4 CPU 3.20ghz
1gb ram
Radeon X1300/X1550 Series

With my 800 dollars, I want something that can hold alot of games running at the same time so I dont have to worry about it. So is a quad really worth it?[/quote]
For $800 you could get something that rapes that
Especially if you build it yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats the hottest setup/computer
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

My current computer that I have I bought for 300 dollars and just upgraded the video card (from a older pc)

Its gonna turn into a peice of shit soon, I can feel it coming. So im gonna toss it to my lil sisters.

My current setup is

Running on vista

Intel® Pentium® 4 CPU 3.20ghz
1gb ram
Radeon X1300/X1550 Series

With my 800 dollars, I want something that can hold alot of games running at the same time so I dont have to worry about it. So is a quad really worth it?

item.title: Whats the hottest setup/computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Old Rsc Player:

Whats the hottest setup/computer out right now.

Well the old Athlon XP CPUs ran pretty hot, you had to have a massive aftermarket fan to keep them cool enough to game with.

Seriously though, as xEnt said, you should use newegg.com, it’s the cheapest and best.

Read full topic
